reviews.text: The staff at this hotel is very helpful! There are a number of persons that made my experience very homely and I must acknowledge in my review.
reviews.title: Very Good Experience & Service

reviews.text: The room was truly exceptional, after a long day it is rewarding to come to and I would recommend the Rhombus Fantasia Chengdu Hotel to anyone looking to relax and feel at home after a long day. The whatever whenever service, is at the name says, the staff really try to help you with just about any issue or concern you may have, I take this time to thank you for your excellent service, acknowledging me by name and making me feel so comfortable to call for anything.
reviews.title: Trendy and Uncomfortable

reviews.text: The atmosphere at the hotel is very lively, the bed is rewarding and amenities in the room was great in the hotel and what you can expect for a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Tastefully done up hotel. Worth a stay.

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and great value!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights. The staff were attentive, the breakfast was fine, and the bed was pretty good but we found the room to be horribly uncomfortable and inconvenient. Given the choice I would never stay there again. The hotel was designed to appeal to people who value style above comfort. There are very few towel racks and no counter space in the bathroom to put your toothbrush, shaving supplies etc. There must be 15 or 16 light switches by the bed, controlling various combinations of lights. It was impossible to figure out what switch turned on or off what light. When we entered the room at night it was pitch black and very hard to find the switch to turn on the light. There is no desk; instead there is a bar with a high stool that is very uncomfortable for working at a computer. The fitness center is not airconditioned and very warm. The pool is outdoors and you have to cross a dirty concrete floor to get to it. In summary, this hotel looks good on paper but it is a very frustrating place to stay.
reviews.title: Stellar Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel after visiting the Big Buddha in Sichuan. The rooms are spacious and have both a large "living room" and bedroom. Also the bathroom is huge. Our room was facing the main street, but there is no noise. You can also enjoy the World go by, by the huge windows, where a kind of a long sofa is located. The reception is located on the first floor (not ground floor) and the reception is not a typical one. It looks more like you go to a travel agency to book your vacation in style. Breakfast is good and rich.
reviews.title: Good and fancy

reviews.text: We had a family trip to Chengdu, Jiuzaigou and Huanglong last Oct 2012. Chengdu was just our stop-over and we thought we would prefer a hotel that's clean, comfortable and convenient. Rhombus Fantasia is definitely clean and comfortable. We did get some good night rest. My parents had the big bed and since I was sharing room with them, I had the additional bed. Even with the additional bed, it was still very comfortable.
reviews.title: Comfort With Great Rest

reviews.text: The only disappointment we had with this hotel was convenience. We had some difficulties to find entertainments such as shopping and getting street food. I'm sure for a business trip, this will really make a great hotel.
reviews.title: Poor customer care!

reviews.text: We are a group of 4 and had just stayed in this hotel for a family trip for 3 nights.  However, we had come across a very poor experience during our stay.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Chengdu

reviews.text: It happened when we were having breakfast on our last day.  While my mum went to get the salad in the restaurant, there was 2 marble-made steps which separated the dining tables and the salad area.  My mum carried her salad with a big dish and needed to walk down the 2 marble steps.  However, the big dish blocked her eye sight and the slippery floor made her fallen 2-step down onto the floor.  Her ankle was injured and the glass dish was of course fallen on the floor and broken.  She then went back to our table with her injured ankle and continued her breakfast.  After about 5 minutes, a waiter suddenly came to our table and asked for a compensation of RMB45 for the broken dish!  It's such a ridiculous matter that it was my mum who was injured, and we had not asked for any compensation for her injury inside the hotel due to slippery floor and the poor design (even myself needed to be very very careful when I carried a big dish and needed to walked down the marble steps, and the sight of which was blocked by the dish).  On the contrary, the hotel asked us to pay them back for the broken dish instead of asking about her injury condition.
reviews.title: Exceptional value.

reviews.text: Centrally located in Chengdu this new hotel is the antithesis of most SOE-owned Chinese business hotels. With funky décor, featuring brown tones subtle lighting and chairs mounted at angles on the walls, the rooms are large, well equipped and comfortable with separate seating area, plentiful gadgets including ipod docks, DVD player, 2 flat screen TVs, remote curtain operations and espresso coffee machines, but rather too complicated for its own good. I couldn't switch off the glowing ipad style directory so simply unplugged it, couldn't get the lights to work or connect my iphone to the sound system. Bathrooms are large with the almost obligatory free standing bath in the window, separate shower, double basins and separate WC. Lack of sheer curtains, only blinds up or down provides interesting entertainment for the workers on the construction site opposite.
reviews.title: Getting there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in a spacious dining room caters well for both western and Chinese tastes, with decent coffee, still rare outside tier 1 cities. Staff are quite friendly, welcoming and speak reasonable English. In all a valiant attempt to introduce some sophistication and style to the CD hotel scene, not quite there yet but certainly well above average.
reviews.title: I recommend this hotel if staying in Chengdu

reviews.text: We liked this hotel. Very clean and modern. Good breakfast. Located near shopping centers and metro station. Staff very good. Not the cheapest hotel but not the most expensive. Good value for money. Cheap taxis in Chengdu. Beware traffic can be very heavy so it can take you hours to get places when the city becomes gridlocked.
reviews.title: Nothing to impress

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights and couldn't get any feeling of boutique hotel. It's just a clean hotel with huge rooms, but lack of atmosphere and genuine guest service. Very average breakfast too. Swimming pool operation hours are quite odd, from 10am to 10pm. Was eager to try in the evening but water temperature was ice cold - maybe a way to avoid guests using this facility?
reviews.title: They are trying....

reviews.text: Beautifully interpreted whimsical chair themed boutique hotel that surprises you. Rooms are fairly spacious with modern bathroom. When you enter the room, only way to turn on the lights is if you insert the room key in a totally counter-intuitive specific direction. They should definitely have people guide you to your room. Rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows and the housekeeping does NOT clean there....my daughter found an empty drink bottle upon check-in in the room, I found cigarette ashes in the bathroom behind the bathtub....New hotel with ipod dock but cannot plug in my ipad or iphone 5. Short-sighted? Service is spotty, one employee let me borrow his personal charger for my ipad, but I couldnt print and send out a scan at 3:00am and received standard come back in the morning,,..
reviews.title: very nice new option in Chengdu

reviews.text: I used to stay in other 5 star hotels in Chengdu while having biz trip here. But this time when I have a personal trip I decided to book something else and found this hotel. I booked G60 room and it really provides me a nice surprise while I checked in. The room is quite big with separated living room (with a high chair bar area), bed room, wardrobe area and bath room. It also provide capsule coffee machine which is a feature for most new 5 start hotels. And the price is very value for money. RMB778 per night. Located in a walking distance to Chun Xi Road which is a shopping area in the city. Highly recommend for Chengdu stay.
reviews.title: Extremely value for money new hotel
